creator: ler@lerctr.org
text:
See my report at freebsd (ports/37633), Basically, if SSL is built in using 
the FreeBSD port (www/apache13-modssl), and you then add the www/mod_php4 
port, the enabling statements for php are placed within the <IfDefined 
SSL></IfDefined SSL> tags.  Apparently this is done via apxs. 

FreeBSD says it's an apache bug.

Sorry for that delay, but as you may guess, the people are somewhat busy
everywhere :)

However, there are good news:
Changed apxs blindness in the current dev branch (2.1) and proposed it for
backport. I'm not sure whether it will happen before 1.3.28 (but I hope so).

Thanks for using Apache!

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 9012 ***
creator: nd@perlig.de
